alert.note: Alert for Clarke; Monroe; Wilcox (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 25 at 9:45AM CDT until March 28 at 6:08PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Alabama... Alabama River Near Claiborne Dam affecting Clarke, Wilcox and Monroe Counties. For the Alabama River...including Millers Ferry Dam, Claiborne Dam... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Alabama River Near Claiborne Dam. * WHEN...Until Monday evening. * IMPACTS...At 40.0 feet, considerable flooding of agricultural land. At 42.0 feet, water begins to inundate the Eureka Landing community. At 43.0 feet, access to Eureka Landing community stops, with access cut off. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 AM CDT Friday the stage was 42.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to gradually rise to a crest of 43.4 feet Sunday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Monday evening and continue a slow fall to 35.4 feet Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 42.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued when updates occur.
